comment: This professor is absolutely amazing! Her lectures are awesome, the coursework is really easy to follow, and If you go to class and pay attention you will get a good grade. She has such a fun energy and it makes you want to come to class. The learning guides she provides will help so much when studying for the unit test. Wonderful Professor : )
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Dr. Martin is my favorite professor at KSU. Many of the comments you'll see here say her assignments and grading are way too hard, but she only teaches 4000-level classes. It's going to be hard. If you want to learn the material, and you ENGAGE, you'll be fine. She gives weekly extra credit, and she is the sweetest professor you'll ever have.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: All the people saying she sets you up to fail probably didn't use all the resources she puts out. She posts what essay questions you'll get ahead of time. She puts out practice quizzes that she pulls from for the tests. Dr. Martin gives out a lot of extra credit opportunities, but you have to come to class. I loved her class you just have to work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: One of the worst professors I've ever taken. All exams are weighed extremely heavy and are super difficult. I failed one exam and it dropped me from an 86 to a 57. She may seem like she cares but she sets you up to fail.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy

comment: AWFULL PROFESSOR!! If you can take anyone else, do it immediately.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: The lectures are boring. She had weekly assignments and quizzes that are boring. The tests are incredibly hard.

Allison Martin is a caring, knowledgeable, and passionate person. She designs this course to be an opportunity to learn and apply the course material. While the difficulty of the course is undeniable, she will help you learn it and succeed if you put in an effort to do so. I would take her if you want to practice psychology and be good at it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: Drop her class if you can.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Avoid at all costs!!

Dr. Martin is a GREAT teacher. She actually teaches and if you put in the effort you will actually learn and pass. The class itself is hard, the work can be difficult, and exams are hard.  She teaches well and is very interactive in lectures. She is super sweet. If you actually want to learn, take her. If you just want to pass, don't take her.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Caring

comment: I don't understand how she has so many positive reviews. I have never felt so much stress from a class in my life. I have never failed a paper before until her class. She is masters lever teaching. You have to have every answer perfect to get full credit. You have an essay at the end of each exam that is HARD! Next day is a paper. TAKE AT OWN RISK!

Dr. Martin is really passionate about the L&B course material and is fantastic at breaking difficult concepts down. She does expect you to know the material well enough to be able to apply it to different scenarios on exams, but she is always happy to answer questions (responds super fast) and prepares you w the module assignments and study guide.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Martin has her Masters's in animal behavior, the toughest grade. If answers are not perfectly defined, they won't count. Failed every module that is due weekly. Includes a quiz and assignment (could take hours), lecture heavy through powerpoints with voiceovers. Tries super hard but the tests are lockdown and an 'applied paper' is due next day.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: She is nice, but such a hard grader. Never worked harder for a class for it to hardly pay off. I think she is better in person, but she tried to keep the class the same for online and it was way too hard. Multiple people failed. She gives a lot of extra credit, but also grades it super hard. Drops an exam but you have to do extra credit to pass
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Martin as a human being is the sweetest lady ever truly. However, DO NOT take her for this course this class was unnecessarily difficult I have never tried so hard in a course and got graded so poorly. The extra credit helps but the test are based of interpretations. Over all she is a great person but this class was hard for no reason.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Lots of homework

comment: I survived but I struggled greatly with exams even though I did a lot of studying. Just be ready to read and apply the different concepts. Thankfully, she did offer extra credit at the end. She does well with responding to emails for assistance.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: Take her. Ive taken two classes with her and shes always super helpful. She cares sooo much for her students. During the start of COVID when classes got moved online mid-semester she extended deadlines and worked with me when I got overwhelmed. I didnt turn in some stuff and I still got a B.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Honestly, this class was relatively easy! She is caring and helpful! You know most of the information going into the class. It's just a lot of work and most people would wait until the last minute to start the work. If you listen to the lectures and do the work ahead of time, you will be fine! Not a completely easy A but an A if you put in the time
rating_tags: Respected--Caring--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Martin's class is difficult if you don't listen/watch the lectures. There are several quizzes on readings (no too bad), several paper sections due (ex: method sec. results sec.), & extra credit. If you don't follow directions, you won't pass. Make sure that you do not procrastinate on work, it takes a while to complete the activities. Uses SPSS
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: I love Dr. Martin. I can see where other people are coming from with L&B, but her Adv. Psych Lab course was excellent. I knew most of the material going into it -- it's a step further from RM, but she's amazing -- caring, loves her job, understanding (esp during the COVID crisis... super helpful). BUT if you don't go to class, you will NOT pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER. Lots of homework. The tests are the hardest tests I have ever taken!! Quizzes are even hard!! She says you will do fine on the tests if you do the study guide, not true and the study guide itself Is 20 pages. By the time you do the study guide you have no time to study. To pass this class you would have to study 50 hours a week.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Martin is a wonderful human. However, this class is unreasonably hard. The amount of material we were required to learn for the tests is outrageous. After filling out the syllabus, I would have 27 pages to understand completely for exams. It's too hard to do without notes. She does give extra credit, but be willing to spend 15+ hours a week.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Martin is very passionate about L & B. This is not an easy course so you will have to read and attend lectures. If you are unclear on a concept, she provides practical examples. She also gives extra credit. The tests are intense but she provides a thorough study guide. I felt like I actually learned instead of just memorizing definitions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dont take her she failed me on pretty much everything and I actually tried. I barley passed. You didnt know what she wanted until AFTER it was due.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I used RMP and was tricked. Her test are difficult because there is no solid answer its her interpretation. 5 question quizzes 10 minutes if you miss two you automatically fail. I just think the class was unnecessarily hard. I love psych and this class was not enjoyable. Wouldnt recommend.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Martin in wonderful. This class is not the most interesting and the concepts are not easy, but Dr. Martin goes above and beyond to help you and wants you do well. Lectures are long, but she does break down the concepts. Lengthy hw, but assignments are helpful. Offers extra credit and very easy to get into contact with outside of class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: Dr. Martin is wonderful. She gives a lot of homework assignments, but it is very clear grading criteria and she is a fair grader. She offers extra credit opportunities. Attendance is important as there is many in class assignments also. She was really kind and understanding and willing to work with her students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Martin's lectures are dry and boring at times, but she really helped me understand the material well. Homework assignments that are geared towards the lit review are due about every week, labs, exams, and optional final, and in class quizzes. I heard some bad things about her, but if you work for it you can make an A!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Martin is so very sweet and cares deeply about her students. Research Methods is a hard class nevertheless, but she made it as best as possible. Her lectures were a little spacy/boring... but I also have the attention span of a 5-year-old. I would take her again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is a wonderful person, but her teaching approach needs to be better. Her lectures are long and very confusing. If you want to pass, I recommend reading the textbook and meeting with her outside of class. She requires three tests ,an option final, two miny papers, a behavioral modification project, pop quizzes,a fun theory project,etc.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Martin is great!!! She is always chill and happy. She's funny and passionate about the content too. It makes me happy when I see how excited she is about the material. Her voice is nice to listen to as well. Very pleasant and easy to understand. One of the best teachers I've had at KSU! Wish I could take her again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Prof Martin was amazing. The content of 2300 can be difficult but she did a great job teaching it. She answers any questions and gives helpful feedback. She graded everything in a timely manner and structure was simple; 3 tests, weekly HW (simple & helpful), labs every week, lit review due at the end of semester, and an optional final.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Favorite class and prof! She was trained in animal behavior and makes L&B so much fun. She shows you the applied sides of psychology like I had not experienced in other courses that are 4 credit hours. She utilizes that extra credit hour for applied activities. You will think of behavior in a different light forever I promise you that.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: This is my favorite professor/class ever! We had 4 tests including the final with one dropped, so if you're good with your grade you don't have to take the final. Gives study guides, extra credit, brings in really cool professionals, and does applied activities- we had a whole class with a dog and trainer! A real diamond in the rough professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Martin is awesome! She makes difficult material easy to understand and is very passionate about what she teaches. She genuinely wants to see her students succeed. If you have the chance to take her, do it!
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Dr. Martin is an amazing prof. I feel like a lot of the material is more or less a review of basic stats (SD, Z-Scores, etc). She tries her best to make the class interesting and genuinely cares. There are labs every week which are easy points, 4 exams (lowest dropped) and a literature review due at the end of the semester. Do the study guides.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I love Dr. Martin. She really cares about her students and will give great feedback on all assignments. The four tests are fair and she does drop one. There are HW assignments due almost every week. They require some work, but she is also a fair grader.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Dr. Martin is a good professor. She gives clear instructions for HW & detailed feedback. 4 exams but drops the lowest grade & provides a detailed study guide (& TA does reviews). A major lit review paper that's due at the end of the semester (most HW is steps towards it). Gives extra credit. RM is a hard class, but she makes it more enjoyable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK
